title: RBI Grade B - FM - FLM 3 - Objective

quiz.text: A  Transformational leader is a type of person in which the leader is not limited by his or her followers' perception. The concept of transformational leadership is given by ____"A"____ and later it was extended by Bernard M. Bass. Identify A
options: Adam Smith
Henry Mitchell
Adam Linkert
Henry Grantt
None of the above

quiz.text: _____________"X"_________________ refers to the ability to perceive, control, and evaluate emotions, it can be learned and strengthened, while others claim it is an inborn characteristic.
options: Mental Intelligence
Mental aptitude
Emotional intelligence
Emotional revolution
None of the above

quiz.text: Identify the model of organisational behavior, wherein Managers adopt relationship-oriented organization behavior and allow employees to participate in the decision-making process. Communication is two-way and a healthy work climate is ensured which takes care of the human side of the organization.
options: Autocratic model
Collegial model
System model
Custodial model
Supportive model

quiz.text: To prevent the incidence of financial frauds, the concept of a Red Flagged Account (RFA) was introduced in 2015 as part of the early warning system. “A RFA is one where a suspicion of fraudulent activity is thrown up by the presence of one or more early warning signals (EWS).” Accordingly, banks must set up systems for identifying EWS and flagging the accounts as RFA for exposures of _________"X"____________ crore and above. Identify X
options: 10 Crore
20 Crore
30 Crore
40 Crore
50 Crore

quiz.text: The delivery of FX deals can be settled in many ways, in the same regard, identify the settlement mechanism, wherein Settlement of funds takes place on the second working day after/following the date of contract/deal
options: Ready or Cash
Spot
Tom
Forward
None of the above

quiz.text: In the case of _X_ lending is done in the name of _X_ not individuals i.e. group lending is done while in the case of _Y_ lending is done to individual members though all members are guarantors of each other. _X_ members generally undertake the same activity and work together while _Y_ members invest loan amounts for different purposes. The above paragraph highlights the difference between X and Y. What are X and Y?
options: X- Joint Liability Groups and Y-Self Help Groups.
X- Self Help Groups and Y-Joint Liability Groups.
X- Moneylenders and Y- Cooperative Societies.
X- Cooperative Societies and Y-Moneylenders.
None of the above.

quiz.text: You are given the following information regarding the financing activities of R Ltd. Issue of Equity Shares: 60,000 Dividend received: 12,000 Redemption of Debenture: 50,000 Find Cash flows from Financing Activities.
options: 14,000
(48,000)
2000
12,000

quiz.text: Recently, in March 2022, the RBI has notified about NaBFID - All India Financial Institution (AIFI). NaBFID shall be regulated and supervised as an All-India Financial Institution (AIFI) by the Reserve Bank under Sections 45L and section _______________ of the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934. It shall be the fifth AIFI after EXIM Bank, NABARD, NHB and SIDBI.
options: Section 45A
Section 45N
Section 45Z
Section 45P
Section 45O

quiz.text: Ramesh wants to execute a block deal, therefore the minimum amount of deal will be __________________ ?
options: 5 Crore
14 Crore
15 Crore
25 Crore
10 Crore

quiz.text: Read the following statements and thereafter select the correct statement
options: Deposit Insurance and Credit Guarantee Corporation (DICGC) came into existence on July 15, 1961
ReBIT has been set up by the Reserve Bank of India, for its IT and cybersecurity needs and to ensure cyber resilience of Indian banking. It was established in 2014
RBIH would be guided and managed by a Governing Council (GC) led by a chairperson, Shri Ajay Chaudhary
Bhartiya Reserve Bank Note Mudran Private Limited (BRBNMPL) was established by Reserve Bank of India (RBI) as its wholly owned subsidiary on 3rd February 1996
All of the above statements are incorrect

quiz.text: The term ethics is derived from the Greek word, "Ethikos meaning conduct, custom or habit. Ethics can be defined as moral philosophy which deals with moral conduct, judgment, habit, charter, rules or principles. Human conduct which is the foundation of ethics, deals with right or wrong conduct with reference to the supreme ideals of life. Ethical Theories are attempts to provide a clear, unified account of what our ethical obligations are. They are attempts, in other words, to tell a single “story” about what we are obligated to do, without referring directly to specific examples. It is common in discussions of business ethics to appeal to one or more ethical theories in an attempt to clarify what it is right or wrong to do in particular situations.  In the same regard, there are many ethical theories, for example, ___________"A"_________________ theory of ethics, provides equality in the matter of distribution of burdens and benefits. This is an important theory of distributive justice. This theory seems to give importance to absolute equality. It does not consider ability, efforts and need. Whereas __________"B"____________ theory of ethics, explains that everybody should receive the benefits according to his contribution. Thus, a worker whose productivity is higher will get higher wages than a laborer whose productivity is low.   Moving ahead, ________"Z"__________ theory of ethics, is based on 3 principles, which are, (1) equal liberty for all citizens, (2) equality of opportunities for everybody and (3)Difference Principle and this theory of ethics provides an provides an alternative to the theory of utilitarianism and at last, we have Marxian Theory of ethics. Karl Marx (1867) was of the view that only the establishment of communism could guarantee the need-based wage payments to workers. Thus, communism to Marx is a just economic system. From the following given statements, identify the incorrect statement, regarding Marxian Theory of ethics
options: According to Karl Marx, The needs should include not only the individual needs but also the social needs of human being
According to Karl Marx, Justice requires that the wage system should be need-based.
Every worker creates a surplus value which is equal to the total productivity of labor minus the wage that is paid to him, which is kept by the capitalists.
According to Karl Marx, A capitalist mode of production in the long run creates a pool of employed labour
All of the above statements are correct

quiz.text: The term ethics is derived from the Greek word, "Ethikos meaning conduct, custom or habit. Ethics can be defined as moral philosophy which deals with moral conduct, judgment, habit, charter, rules or principles. Human conduct which is the foundation of ethics, deals with right or wrong conduct with reference to the supreme ideals of life. Ethical Theories are attempts to provide a clear, unified account of what our ethical obligations are. They are attempts, in other words, to tell a single “story” about what we are obligated to do, without referring directly to specific examples. It is common in discussions of business ethics to appeal to one or more ethical theories in an attempt to clarify what it is right or wrong to do in particular situations. In the same regard, there are many ethical theories, for example, ___________"A"_________________ theory of ethics, provides equality in the matter of distribution of burdens and benefits. This is an important theory of distributive justice. This theory seems to give importance to absolute equality. It does not consider ability, efforts and need. Whereas __________"B"____________ theory of ethics, explains that everybody should receive the benefits according to his contribution. Thus, a worker whose productivity is higher will get higher wages than a laborer whose productivity is low. Moving ahead, ________"Z"__________ theory of ethics, is based on 3 principles, which are, (1) equal liberty for all citizens, (2) equality of opportunities for everybody and (3)Difference Principle and this theory of ethics provides an provides an alternative to the theory of utilitarianism and at last, we have Marxian Theory of ethics. Karl Marx (1867) was of the view that only the establishment of communism could guarantee the need-based wage payments to workers. Thus, communism to Marx is a just economic system. Identify A from the following given options
options: Utilitarian Theory
Egalitarian Theory
Capitalist Theory
John Rawls Theory
Libertarian Theory

quiz.text: The term ethics is derived from the Greek word, "Ethikos meaning conduct, custom or habit. Ethics can be defined as moral philosophy which deals with moral conduct, judgment, habit, charter, rules or principles. Human conduct which is the foundation of ethics, deals with right or wrong conduct with reference to the supreme ideals of life. Ethical Theories are attempts to provide a clear, unified account of what our ethical obligations are. They are attempts, in other words, to tell a single “story” about what we are obligated to do, without referring directly to specific examples. It is common in discussions of business ethics to appeal to one or more ethical theories in an attempt to clarify what it is right or wrong to do in particular situations. In the same regard, there are many ethical theories, for example, ___________"A"_________________ theory of ethics, provides equality in the matter of distribution of burdens and benefits. This is an important theory of distributive justice. This theory seems to give importance to absolute equality. It does not consider ability, efforts and need. Whereas __________"B"____________ theory of ethics, explains that everybody should receive the benefits according to his contribution. Thus, a worker whose productivity is higher will get higher wages than a laborer whose productivity is low. Moving ahead, ________"Z"__________ theory of ethics, is based on 3 principles, which are, (1) equal liberty for all citizens, (2) equality of opportunities for everybody and (3)Difference Principle and this theory of ethics provides an provides an alternative to the theory of utilitarianism and at last, we have Marxian Theory of ethics. Karl Marx (1867) was of the view that only the establishment of communism could guarantee the need-based wage payments to workers. Thus, communism to Marx is a just economic system. Identify B from the following given options
options: Utilitarian Theory
Egalitarian Theory
Capitalist Theory
Socialist Theory
John Rawls Theory

quiz.text: The term ethics is derived from the Greek word, "Ethikos meaning conduct, custom or habit. Ethics can be defined as moral philosophy which deals with moral conduct, judgment, habit, charter, rules or principles. Human conduct which is the foundation of ethics, deals with right or wrong conduct with reference to the supreme ideals of life. Ethical Theories are attempts to provide a clear, unified account of what our ethical obligations are. They are attempts, in other words, to tell a single “story” about what we are obligated to do, without referring directly to specific examples. It is common in discussions of business ethics to appeal to one or more ethical theories in an attempt to clarify what it is right or wrong to do in particular situations. In the same regard, there are many ethical theories, for example, ___________"A"_________________ theory of ethics, provides equality in the matter of distribution of burdens and benefits. This is an important theory of distributive justice. This theory seems to give importance to absolute equality. It does not consider ability, efforts and need. Whereas __________"B"____________ theory of ethics, explains that everybody should receive the benefits according to his contribution. Thus, a worker whose productivity is higher will get higher wages than a laborer whose productivity is low. Moving ahead, ________"Z"__________ theory of ethics, is based on 3 principles, which are, (1) equal liberty for all citizens, (2) equality of opportunities for everybody and (3)Difference Principle and this theory of ethics provides an provides an alternative to the theory of utilitarianism and at last, we have Marxian Theory of ethics. Karl Marx (1867) was of the view that only the establishment of communism could guarantee the need-based wage payments to workers. Thus, communism to Marx is a just economic system. 'Identify Z from the following given options
options: Utilitarian Theory
Egalitarian Theory
Capitalist Theory
Socialist Theory
John Rawls Theory

quiz.text: Read the following statements and then select the right code from the following Statement A - Policy is mostly related to the environmental factors, whereas strategy is related to the organisational factorsStatement B - Policy indicated destination and strategy Indicates route to reach destination Statement C - Strategy represents Mission and Vision of Organization, whereas policy talks about the Objective of Organization
options: Only Statement A is correct
Only Statement B is correct
Only Statement C is correct
Only Statement A and B are correct
Only Statement A and C are correct

quiz.text: Read the following statements and then select the right code from below  Statement A - Under the inverted V network of communication, two subordinates through the hierarchical chain communicate with a superior. Statement B - Under the Y network of communication, a subordinate communicates with his immediate superior as well as a second superior. Statement C - Under the All-Channel network, all members of a group actively communicate with each other freely. It is the most decentralized type of formal communication network.
options: Only Statement A in incorrect
Only Statement B in incorrect
Only Statement C in incorrect
Only Statement A and B are incorrect
Only Statement A and C are incorrect

quiz.text: Read the following statement, regarding Johari Windows and then select the right code from following Statement A - Unknown to Self quadrant of Johari window is also known as Private Area. Statement B - There are 4 quadrants in the Johari Window Statement C - Johari Window is a useful framework to analyze self-awareness. which was given by Johari Window is Joseph Luft and keith davis
options: Only Statement A is incorrect
Only Statement B is incorrect
Only Statement C is incorrect
Only Statement A and B are incorrect
Only Statement A and C are incorrect

quiz.text: Read the following statements and the select the right code  Statement A - Forwards are traded on exchange and futures are not traded on exchange  Statement B - In futures, Terms of the contracts differ from trade to trade and its vice versa in forwards  Statement C - In forwards, price discovery is Not Efficient and its vice versa in futures
options: Only Statement A is correct
Only Statement B is correct
Only Statement C is correct
Only Statement A and B are correct
Only Statement A and C are correct

quiz.text: Read the following statements and then select the right code  Statement A - An open-ended fund may  be listed on the stock exchanges for trading. Statement B - The units of closed-end schemes are not listed on stock exchanges Statement C - For interval mutual fund, units of such mutual fund are listed on the stock exchange where investors can trade in them with other investors
options: Only Statement A is correct
Only Statement B is correct
Only Statement C is correct
Only Statement A and B are correct
Only Statement A and C are correct

quiz.text: Read the following statements are regarding the regulatory sandbox and then select the right code from below  Statement A - RBI Under second cohort, The Net Worth Requirement for participating firms was reduced from the existing ₹25 lakh to ₹10 lakh. Statement B - RBI in November 2021 announced first cohort for Regulatory Sandbox. The Theme was ‘MSME lending" Statement C - There 4 stages in Regulatory Sandbox
options: Only Statement A is incorrect
Only Statement B is incorrect
Only Statement C is incorrect
Only Statement A and B are incorrect
Only Statement B and C are incorrect

quiz.text: Read the following statements and the select the right code  Statement A - Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) set up on April 2, 1990 under an Act of Indian Parliament- the SIDBI Act, 1989 Statement B - NABARD was established on the recommendations of B. Sivaraman Committee, on 12 July 1982 Statement C - SEBI basically came into existence as a non-statutory body in 1992 by a resolution of the Government of India.
options: Only Statement A is correct
Only Statement B is correct
Only Statement C is correct
Only Statement A and B are correct
All of the above statements are correct

quiz.text: XYZ Company reports the following details: Opening inventory: ₹3,50,000 Closing inventory: ₹2,80,000 Purchases made during the year: ₹1,80,000 Wages paid: ₹15,000 Calculate the COGS for XYZ Company based on the given data.
options: ₹1,80,000
₹1,10,000
₹1,55,000
₹2,65,000
₹3,65,000

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), __________ has sold a 4.54% stake in Central Depository Services (India) (CDSL) for Rs 468 crore through a block deal to meet Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) norms.
options: CAMS
National Stock Exchange (NSE)
Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE)
IRCTC
HDFC Bank

quiz.text: Recently (May 2023), the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has decided to introduce risk disclosure framework for individual traders with respect to trading in the equity Futures & Options (F&O) segment. The new framework will come into effect ________.
options: July 1st, 2023
August 1st, 2023
June 30th, 2023
1st September, 2023
31st August, 2023

quiz.text: According to recently (In June), released data by the RBI, what was India's current account deficit (CAD) in the January-March quarter of FY23?
options: $1.3 billion
$0.2 billion
$2 billion
$2.5 billion
$3 billion

quiz.text: Recently (In June), the meeting of the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC), constituted under Section 45ZB of the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934, was held during June 2023, it was the _______ meeting of the MPC.
options: 45th
40th
46th
43rd
39th

quiz.text: Recently (In June), the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has reviewed the borrowing limits in Call and Notice Money Markets for Scheduled Commercial Banks, which among the following bank are excluded from these new borrowing limits?Which of the above statements is incorrect?
options: Private Sector Banks
Regional Rural Banks
Foreign banks in India
Small Finance Bank
Public Sector Banks

quiz.text: Recently, (In June) the RBI has decided to make some enhancements to the TReDS guidelines, accordingly, apart from MSME sellers, buyers and financiers, ____________ are permitted to participate as "4th participant" in TReDS
options: Credit rating agencies
Fintech companies
Investment companies
Insurance companies
IT companies

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), _________ has become the first public sector bank to introduce an IVR-based UPI solution.
options: Bank of Baroda
Indian Bank
Bank of India
UCO Bank
Punjab National Bank

quiz.text: __________ has emerged as the best bank with its net non-performing assets (NPAs) falling as low as 0.25 per cent during the financial year ended March 2023.
options: HDFC Bank
Kotak Mahindra Bank
Bank of India
Bank of Maharashtra
Punjab National Bank
